intro: Banisteria cinerascens, commonly known as the cinerascens bignay, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its striking orange to red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with elongated leaflets and produces small, woody pods that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types. Banisteria cinerascens is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
